questions.question_text: Which IPv4 addressing and routing scheme can increase the availability of a network service during a DoS attack?

discussion.content:
C
Depending on how anycast is implemented, it can also provide a level of high availability. If the advertisement of the anycast route is conditional on some sort of health check (e.g. a DNS query for a well known domain, in this example), then as soon as a server fails its route can be removed. Once the network reconverges, user requests will be seamlessly forwarded to the next closest instance of DNS, without the need for any manual intervention or reconfiguration.

questions.question_text: What are two benefits of protecting the control plane of a network device? (Choose two.)

choices.B: preserves the confidentiality of traffic encrypted by IPsec
choices.A: prevents the delivery of packets from spoof sources
choices.D: maintains remote management access to the router
choices.C: maintains routing protocol adjacencies with local neighbors 46

discussion.content:
CD are correct.
Nor CoPP or CPPr protect against spoofed sources.

choices.D: change the link between R1 and R2 to Area 0
choices.C: create a virtual link between R1 and R2 and decrease the cost between R1 and R3 to 1
choices.B: create a virtual link between R1 and R2
choices.A: convert Area 1 to a stub area and decrease the cost between R1 and R3 to 1

discussion.content: I would go for C. Looks like different colors for different areas and supposedly R2-R4 link is in area 0.

BC are incorrect. Both R1 and R2 belong to area1 and area 1 is connected directly to area0, a virtual link makes absolutely no sense.
D is incorrect, even when all routers are on area 0 the cost via R1 is still higher (not preferred)
A is correct
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kKv8WxI2l6k

questions.question_text: Which two OSPF design considerations should you implement to support the eventual growth of a network, so that CPU and memory are unaffected by the size and complexity of the link-state database in a large service provider network? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Turn on the Incremental SPF feature.

discussion.content:
BC - Agree with Josh
Answer: B,C
Explanation:
Do not change the packet-pacing timers unless all other options to meet OSPF packet flooding requirements have been exhausted. Specifically, network operators should prefer summarization, stub area usage, queue tuning, and buffer tuning before changing the default timers.Furthermore, there are no guidelinesfor changing timer values; each OSPFdeployment is unique and should be considered on a case-by-case basis. The network operator assumes risks that are associated with changing the default timer values.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/iproute_ospf/configuration/xe-16-6/iro-xe-16-6-book/iro-update.html
BC - packet pacing is the last resort

questions.question_text: Your company needs to baseline web traffic on a per-session basis for network application reporting. Which two mechanisms, when combined, fulfill the requirement? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
DE
Nbar for QoS, read class statistics via MIB

choices.D: Class-Based Quality of Service Management Information Base
choices.C: Cisco IOS IP Service Level Agreement
